title: Prasadam Pulihora/ Temple Style Pulihora/ Tamarind Rice
content:
Ingredients: Cooked Rice - 1 medium sized bowl Tamarind extract - 1/2 cup Dry Red chillies - 4 to 5 Cumin seeds/ Jeera - 1 tb sp Sesame seeds - 2 tb sp Pepper corn - 1/2 tb sp Methi / Menthulu/ Fenugreek seeds - 1/2 tb sp Dry roasted Peanuts/ Ground nuts - 4 tb sp Bengal gram/ Senaga pappu - 2 tb sp Urad Dal/ Menapappu - 2 tb sp Coriander seeds/ Daniyalu - 2 tb sp Turmeric powder - 1/2 tea spoon Asaftodia/ Inguva - 1/8 tea spoon Salt - as per taste Sesame/ Mustard Oil - 2 tb sp Coriander - 1/2 cup Procedure: Pulihora powder:
  • Dry roast Jeera, Urad Dal, Bengal gram, Coriander seeds, Fenugreek seeds, Peppercorn and dry Red chillies
  • When they started changing color , add sesame seeds and saute for few seconds
  • Let them cool
  • Blend smooth powder in mixer grinder
  • Heat oil in frying pan on medium heat
  • Add tempering in it
  • For Tempering: Mustard seeds/ Avvalu - 1/4 tea spoon Cumin seeds/ Jeera - 1/2 tea spoon Urad dal/ Minapappu - 1/4 tea spoon Bengal gram/ Senagapappu - 1/4 tea spoon Curry leaves - 4 to 5
  • Add roasted peanuts , asaftodia and turmeric powder
  • Add tamarind extract let it boil( Add 1/2 cup water)
  • Add salt and Pulihora powder and mix them well
  • Saute 2 minutes in low to medium heat
  • Mix Pulihora paste in cooked rice
  • Garnish with coriander
  • Temple style Pulihora is ready
